name: Avoid using "<script>" tag into HTML template used by Angular Application
description: This rule will check that "<script>" tag is not used in the HTML template. <script> tag will not be considered and will be seen as a security issue by Angular application.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: In DOM-based XSS, the client performs the injection of XSS into the page; in the other types, the server performs the injection. DOM-based XSS generally involves server-controlled, trusted script that is sent to the client, such as Javascript that performs sanity checks on a form before the user submits it. If the server-supplied script processes user-supplied data and then injects it back into the web page (such as with dynamic HTML), then DOM-based XSS is possible.
remediation: Ensure you don't inject javascript code into your HTML template.
alternativeName: Avoid using "<script>" tag into HTML template used by Angular Application

qualityStandards.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
The application must protect from Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.
